Join us on this journey to create a positive impact and make a significant change in the world.About The Team And RoleOur small Natural Language Processing team works on providing key NLP competence to improve Quora users’ experience. The team directly supports moderation and growth-related initiatives at Quora. As a remote-first company, our engineers have a high degree of flexibility and autonomy.We are looking for an experienced Staff Machine Learning Engineer to join our growing NLP engineering team. You will have a unique opportunity to have high impact by advancing our NLP systems, as well as uncovering new opportunities to apply large language models to the Quora product. title: Senior Game Designer
details: About the jobUken is looking for a Senior Game Designer to become a driving force on our flagship product, Ava’s Manor. This role will work closely with Developers and Artists to create amazing, fun, social mobile game experiences.  As a Ukenite, you'll be working on meaningful things like:Conceptualizing features and mechanics in detailPrototyping and testing new mechanics and systemsBalancing features and fine tuning the in-game economiesProposing and deploying AB tests to improve KPI’sAnalyzing user behaviour and metrics to perfect the game experienceMentoring and collaborating with other game designersWorking closely with developers and artists to implement ideasResearching competitors and deconstructing top games Your background should include:At least 5 years experience as a Game DesignerProven game design talents and excellent knowledge of free to play game mechanicsThe ability to think through and document designs resulting in cohesive GDDs and feature specsThe ability to comfortably build spreadsheets to manage game economies and feature balanceThe ability to communicate product design and paint a picture with dataAn appetite to learn, grow, and take on increasingly more responsibility It'd be a big plus if you have:Shipped at least 3 large scale or 5+ smaller scale free to play social/mobile game(s)Experience working with wire-framing and prototyping toolsExperience managing a team of game designersA background in programmingA strong foundation in math, economics, or finance We believe in a fun & meaningful work environment:You'll be equipped with a high-end laptop, mobile device Competitive salary, extended health and dental benefits and allowancesYou’ll work in a collaborative, coaching and mentoring cultureRemote and in-person team building events and celebrations4 Day Workweek and Work Anywhere work model! About UsUken builds games that people everywhere love. Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? and Jeopardy! World Tour are the top 2 trivia games, engaging millions of global players every month. In 2020, Uken released Ava’s Manor, a solitaire game where users renovate and decorate the manor while discovering mysterious clues and dabbling in a romantic love story. We consider ourselves data-driven designers, technologists, and artists. Through collaboration, we pair the craft of design with feedback and data to deliver a pace and rhythm in each game session that immerses our audience and leaves them wanting more. We have a quirky, nerdy culture that fosters creativity, collaboration, quality ideas, and a data-driven mindset. We believe in moving quickly and improving constantly, and that mantra is reflected in the weekly updates we make to our games and internal technologies. We have an appetite for pushing technical boundaries but with a focus on practical use.We take entertainment seriously.Uken welcomes applications from racialized people, Indigenous peoples, people with disabilities, and people from gender and sexually diverse groups who would contribute to the further diversification of our team. Uken is committed to offering reasonable accommodation to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or accommodation for any part of the selection process due to a disability, please contact us at jobs@uken.com

details: About the jobCrossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?Are you a Software Architect with an unwavering commitment to well-engineered code who thrives in the fast-paced world of AWS cloud computing? As our Principal Software Architect, you'll lead by example, delivering the most complex features and making the most challenging architectural decisions. You'll have the opportunity to inspire and shape a team of talented engineers, all while remaining hands-on and engaged with the technology you love.If you're a strategic thinker with a proven track record in software architecture and cloud technologies, and you're ready to redefine the future of education, we'd love to hear from you!What You Will Be DoingMaking the most complex architectural decisions in the productReviewing feature design proposals from other team members and simplifying themReviewing the code of other team members for simplicity and correctnessStandardizing best practices into playbooks to improve the quality of the whole teamPrincipal Software Architect Key ResponsibilitiesOwn the architecture and quality of the whole productBasic Requirements5+ years of experience in software development3+ years of experience in software architecture3+ years of experience developing using AWS cloud patternsAbout Gt.schoolgt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly.
